com.github.robtimus.obfuscation

Class Obfuscator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.robtimus.obfuscation.Obfuscator

  • public abstract class Obfuscator
extends Object
    An object that will obfuscate CharSequences or the contents of Readers.
    Author:
    Rob Spoor

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Obfuscator.PortionBuilder
      A builder for obfuscators that obfuscate a specific portion of their input.
      static class  Obfuscator.Prefix
      A prefix of a specific length that uses a specific obfuscator.

        Obfuscates the contents of a CharSequence.

        s - The CharSequence with the contents to obfuscate.
        Returns:
        The obfuscated contents.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the given CharSequence is null.

      • obfuscateText

        public abstract CharSequence obfuscateText(CharSequence s,
                                           int start,
                                           int end)
        Obfuscates parts of the contents of a CharSequence.
        Parameters:
        s - The CharSequence with the contents to obfuscate.
        start - The index in the CharSequence to start obfuscating, inclusive.
        end - The index in the CharSequence to end obfuscating, exclusive.
        Returns:
        The obfuscated contents.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the given CharSequence is null.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the given start index is negative or larger than the given end index, or if the given end index is larger than the given CharSequence's length.

      • obfuscateObject

        public final <T> Obfuscated<T> obfuscateObject(T value)
        Obfuscates a value. The value's string representation will be used to obfuscate the value.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of value to obfuscate.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to obfuscate.
        Returns:
        An Obfuscated wrapper around the given value.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the given value is null.

      • obfuscateObject

        public final <T> Obfuscated<T> obfuscateObject(T value,
                                               Supplier<? extends CharSequence> representation)
        Obfuscates a value.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of value to obfuscate.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to obfuscate.
        representation - A supplier for the character representation that will be used to obfuscate the value. This can be used for values that don't have a sensible string representation of their own.
        Returns:
        An Obfuscated wrapper around the given value.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the given value is or supplier is null.

      • obfuscateList

        public final <E> List<E> obfuscateList(List<E> list)
        Obfuscates a list. For each element, the element's string representation will be used to obfuscate the element.

        The result will be a list that will behave exactly the same as the given list, except it will obfuscate each element when its toString() method is called. This is different from obfuscateObject(Object) because it will not obfuscate the list structure or the number of elements.

        Type Parameters:
        E - The list's element type.
        Parameters:
        list - The list to obfuscate.
        Returns:
        An obfuscating list wrapper around the given list.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the given list is null.

      • obfuscateList

        public final <E> List<E> obfuscateList(List<E> list,
                                       Function<? super E,? extends CharSequence> elementRepresentation)
        Obfuscates a list. For each element, a function will be used to create the element's character representation that will be used to obfuscate the element.

        The result will be a list that will behave exactly the same as the given list, except it will obfuscate each element when its toString() method is called. This is different from obfuscateObject(Object) because it will not obfuscate the list structure or the number of elements.

        Type Parameters:
        E - The list's element type.
        Parameters:
        list - The list to obfuscate.
        elementRepresentation - The function to use to create the character representation for each element.
        Returns:
        An obfuscating list wrapper around the given list.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the given list or function is null.
        Since:
        1.3

      • obfuscateSet

        public final <E> Set<E> obfuscateSet(Set<E> set)
        Obfuscates a set. For each element, the element's string representation will be used to obfuscate the element.

        The result will be a set that will behave exactly the same as the given set, except it will obfuscate each element when its toString() method is called. This is different from obfuscateObject(Object) because it will not obfuscate the set structure or the number of elements.

        Type Parameters:
        E - The set's element type.
        Parameters:
        set - The set to obfuscate.
        Returns:
        An obfuscating set wrapper around the given set.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the given set is null.

This is different from obfuscateObject(Object) because it will not obfuscate the collection structure or the number of elements.

      • obfuscateMap

        public final <K,V> Map<K,V> obfuscateMap(Map<K,V> map)
        Obfuscates a map. For each value, the value's string representation will be used to obfuscate the value.

        The result will be a map that will behave exactly the same as the given map, except it will obfuscate each value when its toString() method is called. This is different from obfuscateObject(Object) because it will not obfuscate the map structure or the number of entries.

        Type Parameters:
        K - The map's key type.
        V - The map's value type.
        Parameters:
        map - The map to obfuscate.
        Returns:
        An obfuscating map wrapper around the given list.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the given map is null.

      • obfuscateMap

        public final <K,V> Map<K,V> obfuscateMap(Map<K,V> map,
                                         Function<? super V,? extends CharSequence> valueRepresentation)
        Obfuscates a map. For each value, a function will be used to create the element's character representation that will be used to obfuscate the element.

        The result will be a map that will behave exactly the same as the given map, except it will obfuscate each value when its toString() method is called. This is different from obfuscateObject(Object) because it will not obfuscate the map structure or the number of entries.

        Type Parameters:
        K - The map's key type.
        V - The map's value type.
        Parameters:
        map - The map to obfuscate.
        valueRepresentation - The function to use to create the character representation for each value.
        Returns:
        An obfuscating map wrapper around the given list.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the given map or function is null.
        Since:
        1.3

      • streamTo

        public abstract Writer streamTo(Appendable destination)
        Returns a writer that, when written to, will obfuscate its contents. The writer should be closed to ensure all obfuscation will take place. Note that closing this writer should not close the given destination if it's Closeable or AutoCloseable.
        Parameters:
        destination - The destination to append the obfuscated contents to.
        Returns:
        A writer that, when written to, will obfuscate its contents.

      • untilLength

        public final Obfuscator.Prefix untilLength(int prefixLength)
        Creates a prefix that can be used to chain another obfuscator to this obfuscator. For the part up to the given prefix length, this obfuscator will be used; for any remaining content another obfuscator will be used. This makes it possible to easily create complex obfuscators that would otherwise be impossible using any of the other obfuscators provided by this library. For instance, it would be impossible to use only portion() to create an obfuscator that does not obfuscate the first 4 characters, then obfuscates at least 8 characters, then does not obfuscate up to 4 characters at the end. With this method it's possible to do that by combining none() and portion(): 
        
 Obfuscator obfuscator = none().untilLength(4).then(portion()
         .keepAtEnd(4)
         .atLeastFromStart(8)
         .build());
        Parameters:
        prefixLength - The length of the part to use this obfuscator.
        Returns:
        A prefix that can be used to chain another obfuscator to this obfuscator.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the prefix length is not larger than all previous prefix lengths in a method chain. In other words, each prefix length must be larger than its direct predecessor.
        Since:
        1.2

      • all

        public static final Obfuscator all()
        Returns an immutable obfuscator that replaces all characters with *. The length of obfuscated contents will be as long as the length of the source.
        Returns:
        An obfuscator that replaces all characters with *.

      • all

        public static final Obfuscator all(char maskChar)
        Returns an immutable obfuscator that replaces all characters with a specific character. The length of obfuscated contents will be as long as the length of the source.
        Parameters:
        maskChar - The character to replace with.
        Returns:
        An obfuscator that replaces all characters with the given mask character.

      • none

        public static final Obfuscator none()
        Returns an immutable obfuscator that does not obfuscate anything. This can be used as default value to prevent having to check for null.
        Returns:
        An obfuscator that does not obfuscate anything.

      • fixedLength

        public static Obfuscator fixedLength(int fixedLength)
        Returns an immutable obfuscator that replaces all characters with a fixed number of *.
        Parameters:
        fixedLength - The fixed length.
        Returns:
        An obfuscator that replaces all characters with the given number of *.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given fixed length is negative.

      • fixedLength

        public static Obfuscator fixedLength(int fixedLength,
                                     char maskChar)
        Returns an immutable obfuscator that replaces all characters with a fixed number of a specific character.
        Parameters:
        fixedLength - The fixed length.
        maskChar - The character to replace with.
        Returns:
        An obfuscator that replaces all characters with the given number of the given character.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given fixed length is negative.

      • fixedValue

        public static Obfuscator fixedValue(String fixedValue)
        Returns an immutable obfuscator that replaces all characters with a fixed value.
        Parameters:
        fixedValue - The fixed value.
        Returns:
        An obfuscator that replaces all characters with the given fixed value.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the given fixed value is null.

      • portion

        public static Obfuscator.PortionBuilder portion()
        Returns a builder for obfuscators that obfuscate a specific portion of their input.
        Returns:
        A builder for obfuscators that obfuscate a specific portion of their input.

      • fromFunction

        public static Obfuscator fromFunction(Function<? super CharSequence,? extends CharSequence> function)
        Returns an obfuscator that uses a function to obfuscate text. This method allows you to create an obfuscator using a predefined function. The returned obfuscator is immutable if the given function is.

        Note: the function should never return null. The returned obfuscator will throw a NullPointerException if the function returns null when obfuscating text.

        Parameters:
        function - The function to use.
        Returns:
        An obfuscator that uses the given function to obfuscate text.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the given function is null.
